question: The Bogor Goals are set of targeted goals that aim to:
option1: restore nearly 150 million hectares of the world’s deforested and degraded lands by 2020
option2: promote free and open trade and investment in the Asia-Pacific region
option3: reduce the damage caused by natural hazards like earthquakes, floods, droughts and cyclones, through an ethic of prevention
option4: eradicate the “triple burden” of malnutrition, undernutrition and micronutrients deficiencies
answer: promote free and open trade and investment in the Asia-Pacific region
explanation: The Bogor Goals are a set of targeted goals that aim at realizing free and open trade and investment in the Asia-Pacific region. It was agreed by member economies of APEC in 1994 in Bogor, Indonesia. The APEC Summit for the year 2017 was held in Da Nang, Viet Nam (November 6-11, 2017). Bogor Goals were the main topics for discussion among the member countries during the summit.
